page.title: 09THE FLOWER SHOW
page.content: Excitement in Bisley amongst gardeners reaches its peak on the last Saturday in August.Months of careful planning culminates in a final display on the judges benches at the Annual Vegetable and Flower Show. Founded in 1863, when its was held on the beautiful lawns of Lypiatt Park, it was revived after the war in 1952 and now has its very own field, left by a perpetual trust. The large marquee is funded by an annual Cider and Cheese Evening. There are nine trophies and various meritorious prizes to be won with classes in flowers, flower arranging, vegetables, jams and bottled fruit cakes and wine. Some of the keenest entrants are the children who have eleven different classes to enter. A flower queen with her attendants and pageboy is crowned at the opening of the Fete in the afternoon.
